column1:
monkey_roo,"2016-01-08T15:25:05.673Z","Asymmetrical Joy","

When this set was first revealed it looked odd, no one (myself included) could quite see what it was, maybe a variant of the B-wing, maybe not, but now we know, it&rsquo
column2: s an alliance transport. Only briefly used in the movie Lego have captured the ships likeness perfectly and given us one of the most interesting builds for a SW ship of this size along the way.
t too much to say about the box, it is maybe a little larger than it needs to be, but the imagery on the front and rear is excellent and certainly helps capture the imagination.
t the largest Force Awakens ship you will build (Poe&rsquo
column4: s Shuttle has 1005 and the Falcon 1329) but it is an interesting build with several interesting parts. The titanium metallic blasters included look great and the very minimal use of four sand grey parts add an interesting colour to the top line. But for me the best part was the 2x4 SNOT part (6123809)

column1: A lot is always made of the minifgs included with a SW set (or any
column15: >licenced set these days) and once again Lego has done a great job here. The two resistance troopers are nicely detail although I have to say I find the overall effect of using the yellow tinted visors a little jarring, as at first glance it appears as though they are using traditional yellow heads rather than the flesh tones.

column1: The main draw figure wise will be Princess Leia &ndash
column2: or should I say General Leia and Admiral Ackbar (a Mon-Calamari who hasn&rsquo
column3: t been promoted in 30 years it would seem).

column1: The Leia figure is simple but nice. The torso printing is excellent and the plain legs look right with the model as do the head and hair (the head has printing on both sides).
For me the stand out figure is Admiral Ackbar the head printing is fantastic and captures his likeness perfectly. The torso is simply decorated but exactly right making him a perfect figure.

The build is a simple but engaging one for such a small ship and this is achieved by the asymmetrical shape of the vessel meaning there are very few repetitive sections to complete. There are also some interesting parts to best of which is the cockpit opening mechanism but also some of the detailed finishing around the engines and the front guns (at least I assume they are guns).
One detractor from the build is the volume of stickers. I normally don&rsquo
column2: t mind a sticker or two but there are a fair number here and where they have to be applied on the cockpit and surrounding area are a bit of a pain (there are three stickers alone for the canopy), so take care or the finish can look really odd and very noticeable. For an extra few &pound
column4: s or so on the RRP I think Lego could have included some printed details here, especially the canopy.

column1: Stickers aside (and assuming you can stick straight unlike me) the finished model is fantastic, the ship is interesting to look at with some good play features (three opening hinge sections, a pair of firing missiles and a cockpit opening mechanism). It is also a brilliant representation of the ship as it appears in the Force Awakens
column2: it may even be the most accurate model to date from the film and fits perfectly with the Battle on Takodana set, which is where we first see the transporter.

column1: This is an almost perfect representation of the Troop Transporter. The build is simple but engaging and happily not repetitive. It is a shame that so many stickers were used to achieve the final look, but that is a minor gripe.
The four figures included are on more than up to Legos high standards and this is the only set with Leia and Ackbar included so if you like your OT figures this is a must have set.
Overall a great looking ship with good play features and figures.

,TRUE,4,5,4,2,4 vikings","2017-03-07T18:33:21.773Z","Good set but not for the price. ","
I bought this set for $35.00 (Original price $70.00) on clearance. I would not have bought this set for it&#39
Box/Instruction: The box was a nice size and it showed the features of the ship very well with the interior of the ship and it'
column3: manual was not in anything. The dimensions of the box are 48x28.2x6.1 cm. and weighed 0.92 kg (2.03 lbs) The manual was very big but not very thick. There were a lot of stickers in this set. I believe it is the most stickers I have ever had in just one set alone in all the Lego set I have bought. There are around 18-20 stickers in this set. They were not very difficult for me to apply but it does take a while to apply them all.&nbsp

column2: There are many unique pieces in this from the cockpit to engines to the inside of the ship. In the very back of the ship there is a big half cylinder grey piece similar to the piece used in the Droid Escape set. It is a very cool piece to get in this big of a set. Some other cool pieces are on the minifigures such as the resistance troopers helmets. The helmets are two pieces and I believe were used in this wave for the first time. The helmets can flip up so you can see the face or can be put down for combat. Also Admiral Ackbar'
column4: head was a very cool piece with so much detail put into and that it is a plastic head and not a rubber one like some other figures have.&nbsp

column2: In this set you get 4 minifigures. You 2 resistance troopers with silver grey blasters, Princess Leia
column3: with a black pistol, and Admiral Ackbar with a black pistol and a clear cup. The resistance troopers both have dark grey pants with two different types of tan jackets. One has a normal tan jacket while the other has brown straps going down the sides of it. Next is Leia, this was a very nice minifig. to get in this set since it is the only older version of her made in Lego. She has a double sided face. She has a swampy green pants with a purple jacket. Her hair piece I believe has been used on older models of her before but instead of it being brown it is tan. Finally there is Admiral Ackbar. This is also a nice minifig. to get since he is not in many sets. He has brown pants with a little printing at the top of them, and comes in an orange uniform. In my opinion he is the best minifig in the set with such detail on his face and the rarity&nbsp

column1: The Build: The set contains a total of 646 pieces. The build took me longer than expected (due to the stickers mainly) but overall it wasn'
column2: t very hard. It took me about an hour or so to build the entire set. The hardest part of the build was when I had to attach&nbsp
column3: the large grey cylinder to the rest of the ship. It would recommend taking your time on this part to delay a set back on the build. Other than that the rest of the ship came along just fine. The best part of the build for me was building the cockpit of the ship. To open the hatch to get into the cockpit they added a little thin light grey technic wheel to turn to open the glass to put the pilot in. This was a very nice feature. Other features include two spring loaded missiles, the top of the ship opens for easier accessability along with ramp in the front that comes down so the soldiers can go into battle. &nbsp

column2: Overall this is a good Star Wars The Force Awakens set. For the price of it though it should have included more minfigs. or have been bigger. There is plenty of space in the inside of the ship. The cockpit of the ship was done very well along with the cannon on ship was very nice to have on the ship
column3: as well. The engines in the back of the ship are some of the best I own and our done really well. Overall it is a very good ship.
t buy it unless you could get for under 60 dollars. It is not worth the orginal price of 70 dollars. Overall if you have a lot of Force Awakens sets but don&#39
column4: t have this one yet I would recommend it getting for the right price. If you are just starting to buy Star Wars I wouldn&#39
column5: t recommend buying this one as a starter. This would be a decent set for the average builder since it is not a hard set to build and is good if you are building a rebel army. &nbsp
column6: Overall opinion for this set though is a 4 star rating for it.&nbsp

column1: I found many rare parts in this set, and probably some of them are new. Very small parts are used instead of longer and bigger ones, creating an effect of an high level of detailing. Pieces are mostly light and dark grey, with a good presence of ocher bricks and some dark red ones.

column2: t that great. Resistance troopers can be found in several sets, and among them Resistance Battle Pack, which features three of them. However they are always nice minifigs, with good paintings and that strange helmet that I do like. Leia is a nice figure, with unusual wearing and a rare haircut (I don'
column5: t very important in Episode VII, so she isn&#39
column7: the same can be said about Ackbar. He appears briefly in the movie, although it'

column9: head that is anyway a rare piece.

column1: The build took about two hours. It was very nice to assemble this set, since as I already said it features many small pieces instead of bigger ones and this made the build particularly interesting. Every part is created with numerous passages
column2: the cockpit, for example, took me about a quarter of hour, because it wasn&#39
column3: t formed only by a seat and a screen. Every part has been made very complex and funny to build, and it&#39
column4: s surely one of the biggest pros of this set.

column2: t as impressive as an AT-AT or an X-wing starfighter, but it&#39
column3: s very nice and unusual. It doesn&#39
column5: feature wings, and this is very rare for a Star Wars vehicles. The level of detailing is impressive, both outside and inside. The most beautiful parts to look at are surely the guns emplacement, the cockpit and the reactors
column6: but the whole model is very nice to look at, &nbsp

column8: their presence is reduced to the minimum.&nbsp

column2: ve to say that it was a very surprising purchase. I didn&#39

,TRUE,4,5,4,4,4 StarKiller22515","2019-12-08T03:32:45.163Z","I see your still wearing the same jacket","

The minifigures included are very cool and 1 of them is exclusive and that is Admiral Ackbar. The 2 resistance fighters are a fine addition to the collection as well so that you have troops to fill up the troop transport. It would have been nice to get one more resistance trooper but its ok that we didn'
column2: t get another one included. The transport appears to be a modified B-Wing with a lot beefier mid section and no rotating cockpit. From what I have done, you can fit a good mount of troops in there with them having solid stud connections. It is a lot more roomy than I first thought. This is a very solid build that is very swoosh able and not very fragile at all. A downside though is that the cockpit has some hard stickers to put on it and that thee are a ton of stickers in this set, including 2 huge ones that you put on a cylinder piece on the back. I would highly recommend buying 1 or 2 of these if you like the resistance faction or the sequel trilogy.

I think that this set is awesome! In the last two years I'
column2: ve increased my old collection of Star Wars set, and I have to say that this Resistance Troop Transporter was&nbsp
